vscp-class.name: VSCP Protocol Functionality
vscp-class.description: This class defines some types that must be implemented by every node that implements the VSCP protocol. The types in this class must be handled by all level I and Level II nodes. Note also that this class is repeated as Level II class=512 with the only difference that GUID's are used instead of nicknames. This means that for all Level II class=512 events the data described here is preceded by the 16-bit destination GUID (address of receiver) stored with MSB first followed by the data specified here. Nickname is present also if documented below but have no meaning and should be discarded.

vscp-type.name: General event.
vscp-type.description: General Event.

vscp-type.name: Segment Controller Heartbeat.
vscp-type.description:
Not mandatory. Implement in device if needed by application.
A segment controller sends this event once a second on the segment that it controls. The data field contains the 8-bit CRC of the segment controller GUID and the time since the epoch (00:00:00 UTC, January 1, 1970) as a 32-bit value. A node that receive (and recognize) this event could respond with a CLASS1.INFORMATION, Type=9 event (HEARTBEAT) and should do so if it does not send out a regular heartbeat event.
Other nodes can originate this event on the segment. For these nodes the data part, as specified below, should be omitted. A better choice for periodic heartbeat events from a node may be CLASS1.INFORMATION, Type=9 (HEARTBEAT)
All nodes that recognize this event should save the 8-bit CRC in non-volatile storage and use it on power up. When a node starts up on a segment it should begin to listen for the Segment controller heartbeat. When/if it is received the node compares it with the stored value and if equal and the node is assigned a nickname-ID it continues to its working mode. If different, the node has detected that it has been moved to a new segment and therefore must drop its nickname-ID and enters the configuration mode to obtain a new nickname-ID from the segment controller.
If the node is in working mode and its nickname-ID changes, the node should do a complete restart after first setting all controls to their default state.
As a segment can be without a segment controller this event is not available on all segments and is not mandatory.

element.name: CRC
element.description: 8-bit CRC of the segment controller GUID

element.name: Time
element.description: Time since epoch.

vscp-type.name: New node on line / Probe.
vscp-type.description:
Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.
This is intended for nodes that have been initiated, is part of the segment and is powered up. All nodes that have a nickname-ID that is not set to 0xFF should send this event before they go on line to do their “day to day” work.
Normally all nodes should save their assigned nickname-ID in non-volatile memory and use this assigned ID when powered up. A segment controller can however keep track of nodes that it controls and reassign the ID to a node that it did not get a new node on-line event from. This is the method a segment controller uses to detect nodes that have been removed from the segment.
For the nickname discovery procedure this event is used as the probe. The difference between a probe and a new node on line is that the later has the same originating nickname as value in byte 0.
If a node send this event with the unassigned ID 0xFF and byte 0 set to 0xFF it has given up the search for a free ID.
It is recommended that also level II nodes send this event when they come alive. In this case the target address is the 16-byte data GUID of the node with MSB in the first byte.

element.name: Target address
element.description: This is the probe nickname that the new node is using to test if this is a valid target node. If there is a node with this nickname address it should answer with probe ACK. A probe always has 0xff as it's own temporary nickname while a new node on line use a non 0xff nickname.

vscp-type.name: Probe ACK.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.\nThis event is sent from a node as a response to a probe. There are no arguments.

vscp-type.name: Set nickname-ID for node.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.\nThis event can be used to change the nickname for a node. The node just uses the new nickname and don't start nickname discovery or similar.

element.name: Old nickname
element.description: Old nickname for node.

element.name: New nickname
element.description: The new nickname for the node.

vscp-type.name: Nickname-ID accepted.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.\nA node sends this event to confirm that it accepts its assigned nickname-ID. When sending this event the node uses its newly assigned nickname address.

vscp-type.name: Drop nickname-ID / Reset Device.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.\nRequest a node to drop its nickname. The node should drop its nickname and then behave in the same manner as when it was first powered up on the segment.

element.name: Nickname
element.description: The current nickname for the node.

element.name: Flags
element.description: Flags.

bitfield.bit: Go idle. Do not start up again.

element.name: Time
element.description: Time the node should wait before it starts a nickname discovery or starts the device. The time is in seconds.

vscp-type.name: Read register.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.\nRead a register from a node.\nIf a node have several pages with user defined registers Extended Register Read is a better choice to choose for reading as the page also is set when reading register using that type. The standard registers can always be read without setting a page though as they are always mapped into the upper 128 bytes.

element.name: Node address
element.description: Node address.

element.name: Register address
element.description: Register to read.

vscp-type.name: Read/Write response.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.\nResponse for a read/write event. . Note that the data is returned for both a read and a write and can and probably should be checked for validity.

element.name: Register address
element.description: Register address read/written.

element.name: Register value
element.description: Value of register.

vscp-type.name: Write register.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.\nWrite register content to a node.\nIf a node have several pages with user defined registers Extended Register Write is a better choice to choose for writing as the page is also set when writing a register using that type. The standard registers can always be read without setting a page though as they are always mapped into the upper 128 bytes.

element.name: Node address
element.description: Node address.

element.name: Register address
element.description: Register to write.

element.name: Register value
element.description: Value which to write to register.

vscp-type.name: Enter boot loader mode.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.\nSend NACK (Class=0,Type=14 if no boot-loader implemented)\nThis is the first event in the boot loader sequence. The node should stop all other activities when in boot loader mode. This also means that the node should not react on other events (commands) then the boot loader related.

element.name: Node address
element.description: The nickname for the node.

element.name: Bootloader algorithm
element.description: Code that select boot loader algorithm to use.

element.name: GUID Byte 0
element.description: GUID Byte 0 (MSB).

element.name: GUID Byte 3
element.description: GUID Byte 3 (MSB + 3).

element.name: GUID Byte 5
element.description: GUID Byte 5 (MSB + 5).

element.name: GUID Byte 7
element.description: GUID Byte 7 (MSB + 7).

element.name: Page select
element.description: Page select, content of register 0x92 and 0x93.

vscp-type.name: ACK boot loader mode.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Only needed if a VSCP boot-loader algorithm is used.\nThis event has no meaning for any node that is not in boot mode and should be disregarded.\nThe node confirms that it has entered boot loader mode. This is only sent for the VSCP boot loader algorithm.

element.name: Flash block size
element.description: Flash block size in byte.

element.name: Number of blocks
element.description: Number of blocks available.

vscp-type.name: NACK boot loader mode.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Should be implemented by all devices.\nThe node was unable to enter boot loader mode. The reason is given by a user specified error code byte. This event has no meaning for any node that is not in boot mode and should be disregarded.

element.name: Error code
element.description: Optional user defined error code.

vscp-type.name: Start block data transfer.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Only needed if a VSCP boot-loader algorithm is used.\nBegin transfer of data for a block of memory. This event has no meaning for any node that is not in boot mode and should be disregarded.

element.name: Block number
element.description: Block number.

element.name: Memory type
element.description: Type of Memory we want to write..

vscp-type.name: Block data.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Only needed if a VSCP boot-loader algorithm is used.\nData for a block of memory. This event has no meaning for any node that is not in boot mode and should be disregarded.

element.name: Data
element.description: Data.

vscp-type.name: ACK data block.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Only needed if a VSCP boot-loader algorithm is used.\nConfirm the reception of a complete data block. This event has no meaning for any node that is not in boot mode and should be disregarded.

element.name: Block CRC
element.description: CRC for block.

element.name: Write pointer
element.description: Write pointer.

vscp-type.name: NACK data block.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Only needed if a VSCP boot-loader algorithm is used.\nNACK the reception of data block. This event has no meaning for any node that is not in boot mode and should be disregarded.

element.name: Error code
element.description: User defined error code.

element.name: Write pointer
element.description: Write pointer.

vscp-type.name: Program data block.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Only needed if a VSCP boot-loader algorithm is used.\nRequest from a node to program a data block that has been uploaded and confirmed. This event has no meaning for any node that is not in boot mode and should be disregarded.

element.name: Block number
element.description: Block number.

vscp-type.name: ACK program data block.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Only needed if a VSCP boot-loader algorithm is used.\nA node confirms the successful programming of a block. This event has no meaning for any node that is not in boot mode and should be disregarded.

element.name: Block number
element.description: Block number.

vscp-type.name: NACK program data block.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Only needed if a VSCP boot-loader algorithm is used.\nA node failed to program a data block. This event has no meaning for any node that is not in boot mode and should be disregarded.

element.name: Error code
element.description: User defined error code.

element.name: Block number
element.description: Block number.

vscp-type.name: Activate new image.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Only needed if a VSCP boot-loader algorithm is used.\nThis command is sent as the last command during the boot-loader sequence. It resets the device and starts it up using the newly loaded code. The 16-bit CRC for the entire program block is sent as an argument. This must be correct for the reset/activation to be performed. NACK boot loader mode will be sent if the CRC is not correct and the node will not leave boot loader mode.

element.name: CRC
element.description: CRC of full flash data block.

vscp-type.name: GUID drop nickname-ID / reset device.
vscp-type.description:
Mandatory. Should be implemented by all devices.
Added in version 1.4.0
This is a variant of Class=0, Type=8 but here the full GUID is used instead of the nickname to identify the node that should drop its current nickname and enter the node-name discovery procedure.
As the GUID is 16 bytes this is a multi-frame event. To ease the storage requirements on the nodes only four GUID bytes are send in each frame. The frames must be sent out within one second interval.

element.name: Index
element.description: Message index.

element.name: GUID [15-12]
element.description: GUID bytes 15 to 12.

element.name: Index
element.description: Message index.

element.name: GUID [11-8]
element.description: GUID bytes 11 to 8.

element.name: Index
element.description: Message index.

element.name: GUID [7-4]
element.description: GUID bytes 7 to 4.

element.name: Index
element.description: Message index.

element.name: GUID [3-0]
element.description: GUID bytes 3 to 0.

vscp-type.name: Page read.
vscp-type.description:
Mandatory. Should be implemented by all devices.
The page read is implemented to make it possible to read/write larger blocks of data. Two register positions are reserved to select a base into this storage. This is a 16-bit number pointing to a 256-byte page. This means that a total of 65535 * 256 bytes are accessible with this method (page 0 is the standard registers).
To read a block of data from the storage, first write the base registers then issue this event and n events will be sent out from the node containing the data from the specified area. If the count pass the border it of the page ( > 0xFF) the transfer will end there.
Note that the page select registers only selects a virtual page that can be accessed with page read/write and not with the ordinary read/write.

element.name: Node id
element.description: Node-ID which registers should be read.

element.name: Index
element.description: Index into page.

element.name: Number of bytes
element.description: Number of bytes to read.

vscp-type.name: Page write.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Should be implemented by all devices.\nThe write page is implemented to make it possible to write larger blocks of data. One data-space positions is reserved to select a base into this storage. See Page read for a full description.\nIt is only possible to write one 6-byte chunk at a time in contrast to reading several. This is because VSCP at Level I is aimed at low end devices with limited resources meaning little room for buffers.

element.name: Node id
element.description: Node-ID which registers should be read.

element.name: Register start
element.description: Register start address.

element.name: Data
element.description: Data to write.

vscp-type.name: Read/Write page response.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Should be implemented by all devices.\nThis is a response frame for the read/write page command. The Sequence number goes from 0 up to the last sent frame for a read page request.

element.name: Sequence number
element.description: Sequence number.

element.name: Data
element.description: Data.

vscp-type.name: High end server/service probe.
vscp-type.description: Should be implemented by all devices that work over 802.15.4/Ethernet/Internet or other high end protocols.This event can be broadcasted on a segment by a node to get information about available servers.\nThe VSCP daemon documentation have a description on how server/service discovery works.

vscp-type.name: High end server/service response.
vscp-type.description: Should be implemented by all devices that work on 802.15.4/Ethernet/Internet and have a Level I link. This is because a Level II device can be present on a Level I bus. A typical example is a Bluetooth gateway. A user find the bud/segment by the Bluetooth device and can then discover other parts of the system through it.\nA Level II node respond with CLASS2.PROTOCOL, Type=32 Level II who is response to this event. It is also possible to listen for CLASS2.PROTOCOL, Type=20 (0x14) High end server capabilities to discover Level II nodes.

element.name: Capability code
element.description: VSCP server capability code.

bitfield.bit: Accepts two or more simultaneous connections on TCP/IP interface. A limited device may only accept one connection.

element.name: Server IP
element.description: Server IP address.

element.name: Server port
element.description: Server port number.

vscp-type.name: Increment register.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Should be implemented by all devices.\nIncrement a register content by one with no risk of it changing in between

element.name: Node-ID
element.description: Node-ID.

element.name: Register address
element.description: Register to increment.

vscp-type.name: Decrement register.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Should be implemented by all devices.\nDecrement a register content by one with no risk of it changing in between

element.name: Node-ID

element.name: Register address

vscp-type.name: Who is there?
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.\nThis event can be used as a fast way to find out which nodes there is on a segment. All nodes receiving it should respond.

element.description: Node-ID or 0xFF for all nodes.

vscp-type.name: Get decision matrix info.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory\nRequest a node to report size and offset for its decision matrix.

element.name: Node address
element.description: Node address.

vscp-type.name: Decision matrix info response.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory for nodes with a decision matrix\nReport the size for the decision matrix and the offset to its storage. The reported size is the number of decision matrix lines. The offset is the offset in the register address counter from 0x00 (See the register model in this document). If the size returned is zero the node does not have a decision matrix. A node without a decision matrix can also skip to implement this event but it's better if it returns a decision matrix size of zero.

element.name: Matrix size
element.description: Matrix size (number of rows). Zero for a device with no decision matrix.

element.name: Offset
element.description: Offset in register space.

element.name: Page start
element.description: Page start.

vscp-type.name: Get embedded MDF.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory.\nA node that get this event and has an embedded MDF description in flash or similar respond with the description .

element.name: Node address
element.description: Node address.

vscp-type.name: Embedded MDF response.
vscp-type.description:
Not mandatory.
This is the response from a Get embedded MDF. The response consist of several frames where an index in byte0/1 is incremented for each frame and MDF data is in byte 2-7.
If an embedded MDF is not available a response on the form
 byte 0 = 0 
 byte 1 = 0 
 byte 2 = 0
should be sent.

element.name: MDF description index
element.description: MDF description index.

element.name: MDF data
element.description: MDF data.

vscp-type.name: Extended page read register.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.\nRead a register from a node with page information.\nImplementation must take care so all page register change done by these routines must restore the content of the page registers to there original content when they are done.

element.name: Node address
element.description: Node address.

element.name: Page
element.description: Page where the register is located.

element.name: Offset
element.description: Register to read (offset into page).

element.name: Number
element.description: Number of registers to read.

vscp-type.name: Extended page write register.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.\nWrite register content to a node.\nImplementation must take care so all page register change done by these routines must restore the content of the page registers to there original content when they are done.

element.name: Node address
element.description: Node address.

element.name: Page
element.description: Page where the register is located.

element.name: Offset
element.description: Register to write (offset into page).

element.name: Value
element.description: Content for register.

vscp-type.name: Extended page read/write response.
vscp-type.description: Mandatory. Must be implemented by all devices.\nThis is the replay sent for events CLASS1.PROTOCOL, Type=40,41.

element.name: Index
element.description: Index (starts at zero).

element.name: Page
element.description: Page where the register is located.

element.name: Offset
element.description: Register read/written.

element.name: Value
element.description: Content of register.

vscp-type.name: Get event interest.
vscp-type.description:
Not Mandatory. Implemented if needed.
It is possible to ask a node which event(s) it is interested in with this event. If not implemented the node is supposed to be interested in all events.
All nodes are by default interested in CLASS1.PROTOCOL.
The event is intended for very low bandwidth nodes like low power wireless nodes where it saves a lot of bandwidth if only events that really concerns the node is sent to them.

vscp-type.name: Get event interest response.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Implemented if needed.\nResponse for event CLASS1.PROTOCOL, Type=40 (Get event interest). The node report all events it is interested in.

element.name: Index
element.description: Index.

element.name: Class bit 9
element.description: Class bit 9.

bitfield.bit: All Type 1 is recognized (set type to zero).
All Type 2 is recognized (set type to zero).
All Type 3 is recognized (set type to zero).

element.name: Class 1
element.description: Class 1.

element.name: Type 1
element.description: Type 1.

element.name: Class 2
element.description: Class 2.

element.name: Type 2
element.description: Type 2.

element.name: Class 3
element.description: Class 3.

element.name: Type 3
element.description: Type 3.

vscp-type.name: Activate new image ACK.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Only needed if a VSCP boot-loader algorithm is used.\nPart of the VSCP boot-loader functionality. This is the positive response after a node received a CLASS1.PROTOCOL, Type=22 (Activate new image). It is sent by the node before the new firmware is booted into.

vscp-type.name: Activate new image NACK.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Only needed if a VSCP boot-loader algorithm is used.\nPart of the VSCP boot-loader functionality. This is the negative response after a node received a CLASS1.PROTOCOL, Type=22 (Activate new image). It is sent by the node to inform it that it will (or can not) switch to the new firmware image.

vscp-type.name: Block data transfer ACK.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory Only needed if a VSCP boot loader algorithm is used.\nPart of the VSCP boot-loader functionality. This is the positive response after a node received a CLASS1.PROTOCOL, Type=16 (Block data) event. It is sent by the node as a validation that it can handle the block data transfer.

vscp-type.name: Block data transfer NACK.
vscp-type.description: Not mandatory. Only needed if a VSCP boot-loader algorithm is used.\nPart of the VSCP boot-loader functionality. This is the negative response after a node received a CLASS1.PROTOCOL, Type=16 (Block data) event. It is sent by the node as an indication that it can NOT handle the block data transfer.

vscp-type.name: Reserved for future use.
vscp-type.description: Reserved for future use.

vscp-type.name: Reserved for future use.
vscp-type.description: Reserved for future use.

vscp-class.name: Measurement
vscp-class.description: Measurements are fetched from the SI units and from SI derived units. The SI unit (or the SI derived unit) is also used as the default unit. As in the SI unit standard, names for a unit is in lower case ("newton") and the unit ("N") is in upper case.

vscp-type.name: General event
vscp-type.description: General Event.

vscp-type.name: Count
vscp-type.description: This is a discrete value typical for a count. There is no unit for this measurement just a discrete value.

element.name: Data coding
element.description: Data coding.

element.name: Data
element.description: Data with format defined by byte 0.

vscp-type.name: Length/Distance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Meter.\nThis is a measurement of a length or a distance.

vscp-type.name: Mass
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Kilogram.\nThis is a measurement of a mass.

vscp-type.name: Time
vscp-type.description: A time measurement.\nDefault unit: Seconds.\nOpt. unit: (1) Milliseconds. Absolute: (2) y-y-m-d-h-m-s (binary). String: (3) "HHMMSS".

vscp-type.name: Electric Current
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Ampere.\nThis is a measurement of an electric current.

vscp-type.name: Temperature
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Kelvin.\nOpt. unit: Degree Celsius (1), Fahrenheit (2)\nThis is a measurement of a temperature.

vscp-type.name: Amount of substance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Mole.\nThis is a measurement of an amount of a substance.

vscp-type.name: Luminous Intensity (Intensity of light)
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Candela.\nThis is a measurement of luminous intensity.

vscp-type.name: Frequency
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Hertz.\nThis is a measurement of regular events during a second.

vscp-type.name: Radioactivity and other random events
vscp-type.description: Default unit: becquerel.\nOptional unit: curie (1)\nThis is a measurement of rates of things, which happen randomly, or are unpredictable.

vscp-type.name: Force
vscp-type.description: Default unit: newton.\nThis is a measurement of force.

vscp-type.name: Pressure
vscp-type.description: Default unit: pascal.\nOpt. unit: bar (1), psi (2)\nThis is a measurement of pressure.

vscp-type.name: Energy
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Joule.\nOptional unit: KWh (1)\nThis is a measurement of energy.

vscp-type.name: Power
vscp-type.description: Default unit: watt.\nOptional unit: Horse power (1).\nThis is a measurement of power.

vscp-type.name: Electrical Charge
vscp-type.description: Default unit: coulomb.\nThis is a measurement electrical charge.

vscp-type.name: Electrical Potential (Voltage)
vscp-type.description: Default unit: volt.\nThis is a measurement of electrical potential.

vscp-type.name: Electrical Capacitance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: farad (F).\nThis is a measurement of electric capacitance.

vscp-type.name: Electrical Resistance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: ohm (Ω).\nThis is a measurement of resistance.

vscp-type.name: Electrical Conductance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: siemens.\nThis is a measurement of electrical conductance.

vscp-type.name: Magnetic Field Strength
vscp-type.description: Default unit: amperes per meter (H).\nOptional units: teslas (B) (1)\nThis is a measurement of magnetic field strength.

vscp-type.name: Magnetic Flux
vscp-type.description: Default unit: weber (Wb).\nThis is a measurement of magnetic flux.

vscp-type.name: Magnetic Flux Density
vscp-type.description: Default unit: tesla (B).\nThis is a measurement of flux density or field strength for magnetic fields (also called the magnetic induction).

vscp-type.name: Inductance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: henry (H).\nThis is a measurement of inductance.

vscp-type.name: Luminous Flux
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Lumen (lm= cd * sr)\nThis is a measurement of luminous Flux.

vscp-type.name: Illuminance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: lux (lx) ( lx = lm / m² )\nThis is used to express both Illuminance (incidence of light) and Luminous Emittance (emission of light).

vscp-type.name: Radiation dose
vscp-type.description: Default unit: gray (Gy).\nOpt unit: sievert (Sv) (1).\nThis is a measurement of a radiation dose (Absorbed dose of ionizing radiation).

vscp-type.name: Catalytic activity
vscp-type.description: Default unit: katal (z).\nThis is a measurement of catalytic activity used in biochemistry.

vscp-type.name: Volume
vscp-type.description: Default unit: cubic meter (m³)\nOpt. unit: Liter (dm³) (1), decilitre (100 cm³) (2), centilitre (10 cm³) (3), millilitre (cm³) (4) where unit 4 is only available for Level II measurement events where units can hold this value.\nThis is a measurement of volume.

vscp-type.name: Sound intensity
vscp-type.description: Default unit: W/m2, watt per square meter.\nThis is a measurement of sound intensity (acoustic intensity).

vscp-type.name: Angle
vscp-type.description:
Default unit: radian (rad) (Plane angles).
Opt Unit: degree (1).
Opt Unit: arcminute (2).
Opt Unit: arcseconds (3).
This is a measurement of an angle.

vscp-type.name: Position WGS 84
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Longitude.\nOpt. unit: Latitude.\nThis is a measurement of a position as of WGS 84. Normally given as a floating point value. See ./class1.gps.md for a better candidate to use for position data.

vscp-type.name: Speed
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Meters per second.\nOptional unit: Kilometers per hour (1) Miles per hour (2)\nThis is a measurement of a speed.

vscp-type.name: Acceleration
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Meters per second/second (m/s2).\nThis is a measurement of acceleration.

vscp-type.name: Tension
vscp-type.description: Default unit: N/m.\nThis is a measurement of tension.

vscp-type.name: Damp/moist (Hygrometer reading)
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Relative percentage 0-100%.\nThis is a measurement of relative moistness (Humidity).

vscp-type.name: Flow
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Cubic meters/second.\nOpt Unit: Liters/Second.\nThis is a measurement of flow.

vscp-type.name: Thermal resistance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Thermal ohm K/W.\nThis is a measurement of thermal resistance.

vscp-type.name: Refractive (optical) power
vscp-type.description: Default unit: dioptre (dpt) m-1.\nThis is a measurement of refractive (optical) power.

vscp-type.name: Dynamic viscosity
vscp-type.description: Default unit: poiseuille (Pl)\nThis is a measurement of dynamic viscosity.

vscp-type.name: Sound impedance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: rayl (Pa·s/m)\nThis is a measurement of sound impedance.

vscp-type.name: Sound resistance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Acoustic ohm Pa · s/ m³.\nThis is a measurement of sound resistance.

vscp-type.name: Electric elastance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: daraf (f-1).\nThis is a measurement of electric elasticity.

vscp-type.name: Luminous energy
vscp-type.description: Default unit: talbot ( tb = lm * s)\nThis is a measurement of luminous energy.

vscp-type.name: Luminance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: cd / m²) (non SI unit = nit)\nThis is a measurement of luminance.

vscp-type.name: Chemical concentration
vscp-type.description: Default unit: molal (mol/kg).\nThis is a measurement of chemical concentration.

vscp-type.name: Reserved
vscp-type.description: Reserved (previously was doublet of Type= 26, don't use any longer!)

vscp-type.name: Dose equivalent
vscp-type.description: Default unit: sievert (J/Kg).\nThis is a measurement of dose equivalent.

vscp-type.name: Reserved
vscp-type.description: Reserved (was doublet of Type= 24, do not use any longer!)

vscp-type.name: Dew Point
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Kelvin.\nOpt. unit: Degree Celsius (1), Fahrenheit (2)\nThis is a measurement of the Dew Point.

vscp-type.name: Relative Level
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Relative value.\nThis is a relative value for a level measurement without a unit. It is just relative to the min/max value for the selected data representation, typically percentage or per mille or similar.

vscp-type.name: Altitude
vscp-type.description: Default unit: Meter.\nOpt. unit: Feet(1), inches (2)\nAltitude in meters.

vscp-type.name: Area
vscp-type.description: Default unit: square meter (m²)\nArea in square meter.

vscp-type.name: Radiant intensity
vscp-type.description: Default unit: watt per steradian ( W / sr )\nRadiated power per room angle.

vscp-type.name: Radiance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: watt per steradian per square metre ( W / (sr * m²) )\nThis is the radiant flux emitted, reflected, transmitted or received by a surface.

vscp-type.name: Irradiance, Exitance, Radiosity
vscp-type.description: Default unit: watt per square metre ( W / m² )\nPower emitted from or striking onto a surface or area.

vscp-type.name: Spectral radiance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: watt per steradian per square metre per nm (W·sr-1·m-2·nm-1)\nOpt. unit: watt per steradian per meter3 (W·sr-1·m-3) (1), watt per steradian per square metre per hertz (W·sr-1·m-3) (2)\nRadiance of a surface per unit frequency or wavelength.

vscp-type.name: Spectral irradiance
vscp-type.description: Default unit: watt per square metre per nm (W·m-2·nm-1)\nOpt. unit: watt per metre3 (W·m-3) (1), watt per square metre per hertz (W·m-2·Hz-1) (2)\nIrradiance of a surface per unit frequency or wavelength.

vscp-type.name: Sound pressure (acoustic pressure)
vscp-type.description: Default unit: pascal (Pa)\nThis is a measurement of sound pressure (acoustic pressure).

vscp-type.name: Sound energy density
vscp-type.description: Default unit: pascal (Pa)\nSound energy density or sound density is the sound energy per unit volume.

vscp-type.name: Sound level
vscp-type.description: Default unit: decibel (dB)\nSound level expressed in decibel. This event is supplied for convenience.

vscp-class.name: Data
vscp-class.description: Representation for different general data types. Byte 0 is the data coding byte described here. Unit may not have meaning for some of the types and should be set to zero in that case.

vscp-type.name: General event
vscp-type.description: General event.

vscp-type.name: I/O value
vscp-type.description: General I/O value. First data byte defines format.

vscp-type.name: A/D value
vscp-type.description: General A/D value. First data byte defines format.

vscp-type.name: D/A value
vscp-type.description: General D/A value. First data byte defines format.

vscp-type.name: Relative strength
vscp-type.description: Relative strength.

vscp-type.name: Signal Level
vscp-type.description: Signal Level is a relative strength value that (as default) has its maximum at 100 and minimum at 0 interpreted as a percentage. For a digital transmission Signal Level it can be used to give an indication of the analogue signal and CLASS1.DATA, Type = 6, Signal Quality can be used to give an indication of the quality of the digital part as BER (Bit Error Ratio) for example.

vscp-type.name: Signal Quality
vscp-type.description: Signal Quality be used to give an indication of the quality of the digital part as BER (Bit Error Ratio) for example.

vscp-class.name: Information
vscp-class.description: Most of the events below have an index parameter that can be used to indicate which of several SECO (sensor/control) units on a node originated the event. Set to zero if the node only control one item.

vscp-type.name: Node Heartbeat
vscp-type.description: Heartbeats can be used to indicate that a unit is alive or to send periodic data. This can be sent out at predefined intervals to indicate that the node is alive, however, it does not necessarily mean the node is functioning as it should. It simply states that the node is connected to the network. To check if a node is functioning, other properties such as a measurement event or registry should be used. This event should be sent as a response to a “Segment Status Heartbeat” (CLASS1.PROTOCOL, Type=1) in order to provide a method of finding out what is connected to the network. The data bytes from byte 3 and forward can be used to send a descriptive/user friendly name if desired.\nMandatory. All nodes should send this event at least once each minute. A Level II node should normally not send this event but instead send Level II node heartbeat. Recommended interval is 30-60 seconds but in a node that need to sleep longer to save resources a longer interval can be used.

vscp-type.name: Civil sunrise twilight time
vscp-type.description:
Civil twilight is the period when the Sun is below the horizon but its center is less than 6 degrees below. The "Civil Twilight Starts" time is the dawn or civil dawn, with the center of the Sun at exactly 6 degrees below the horizon. Equally, the "Civil Twilight Ends" time is dusk or civil dusk, when the Sun is 6 degrees below the horizon in the evening.
During civil twilight, the sky is still illuminated, and with clear weather it is brightest in the direction of the Sun. The Moon and the brightest stars and planets may be visible. It is usually bright enough for outdoor activities without additional lighting.
Near the equator, where the Sun sets and rises in an almost vertical direction, the civil twilight period can last only 21 minutes, a very fast nightfall compared to the much longer periods at southern and northern latitudes. In regions north of 60°24' N or south of 60°24' S, there will be at least one night when it does not get darker than this.
Technically, the start and end times are when the true geocentric position of the Sun is 96 degrees from the zenith position.
A node indicates that sunrise twilight time is detected/calculated.

element.description: User specific.

vscp-type.name: Civil sunset twilight time
vscp-type.description:
A node indicates that sunset twilight time is detected/calculated.
Civil twilight is the period when the Sun is below the horizon but its center is less than 6 degrees below. The "Civil Twilight Starts" time is the dawn or civil dawn, with the center of the Sun at exactly 6 degrees below the horizon. Equally, the "Civil Twilight Ends" time is dusk or civil dusk, when the Sun is 6 degrees below the horizon in the evening.
During civil twilight, the sky is still illuminated, and with clear weather it is brightest in the direction of the Sun. The Moon and the brightest stars and planets may be visible. It is usually bright enough for outdoor activities without additional lighting.
Near the equator, where the Sun sets and rises in an almost vertical direction, the civil twilight period can last only 21 minutes, a very fast nightfall compared to the much longer periods at southern and northern latitudes. In regions north of 60°24' N or south of 60°24' S, there will be at least one night when it does not get darker than this.
Technically, the start and end times are when the true geocentric position of the Sun is 96 degrees from the zenith position.

element.name: User specific
element.description: User specific.

element.name: Zone

element.name: Sub-Zone
element.description: Sub-Zone for which event applies to (0-255). 255 is all sub-zones.

vscp-type.name: Nautical sunrise twilight time
vscp-type.description:
A node indicates that nautical sunrise twilight time is detected/calculated.
Nautical twilight is the period when the center of the Sun is between 6 and 12 degrees below the horizon, when bright stars are still visible in clear weather and the horizon is becoming visible. It is too dark to do outdoor activities without additional lighting.
In the morning, nautical twilight starts at nautical dawn, when the Sun rises above 12 degrees below the horizon; it ends when the Sun's center reaches 6 degrees below the horizon. In the evening, nautical twilight begins when the Sun sinks below 6 degrees; it ends at nautical dusk, when the Sun is lower than 12 degrees below the horizon.
For locations north of 54°34' N or south of 54°34' S latitude, the Sun will never be lower than 12 degrees below the horizon for a period in the summer.
Technically, the start and end times are when the true geocentric position of the Sun is 102 degrees from the zenith position.

vscp-type.name: Nautical sunset twilight time
vscp-type.description:
A node indicates that nautical sunset twilight time is detected/calculated.
Nautical twilight is the period when the center of the Sun is between 6 and 12 degrees below the horizon, when bright stars are still visible in clear weather and the horizon is becoming visible. It is too dark to do outdoor activities without additional lighting.
In the morning, nautical twilight starts at nautical dawn, when the Sun rises above 12 degrees below the horizon; it ends when the Sun's center reaches 6 degrees below the horizon. In the evening, nautical twilight begins when the Sun sinks below 6 degrees; it ends at nautical dusk, when the Sun is lower than 12 degrees below the horizon.
For locations north of 54°34' N or south of 54°34' S latitude, the Sun will never be lower than 12 degrees below the horizon for a period in the summer.
Technically, the start and end times are when the true geocentric position of the Sun is 102 degrees from the zenith position.

vscp-type.name: Astronomical sunrise twilight time
vscp-type.description:
A node indicates that astronomical sunrise twilight time is detected/calculated.
Astronomical twilight is the period when the center of the Sun is between 12 and 18 degrees below the horizon. It starts at astronomical dawn, early in the morning when the Sun is higher than 18 degrees below the horizon. From this point, it will be difficult to observe certain faint stars, galaxies, and other objects because the Sun starts to illuminate the sky. Astronomical twilight ends at astronomical dusk in the late evening, when those faint objects again can be visible because the Sun is lower than 18 degrees below the horizon. In locations north of 48°24' N or south of 48°24', it never gets darker than this near the middle of the summer solstice (June or December).
Technically, the start and end times are when the true geocentric position of the Sun is 108 degrees from the zenith position, or directly above the observer.
Astronomical twilight is the period when the center of the Sun is between 12 and 18 degrees below the horizon.

vscp-class.name: Control
vscp-class.description: Control functionality. One of the main concepts of VSCP is that it is an event driven protocol. Commands are sent out as events to the network not as events to specific devices. A device can belong to a zone which select limit events of interest for the particular node.. If there is a need to control a specific device the registry model should be used. This is the only way to directly control a device.

vscp-type.description: This is typically for adjusting the contrast level of a display device

element.name: Data0
element.description: A value between 0 and 127 indicates the specific contrast level to set. A value between 128 and 159 is change down by the specified number of contrast levels. A value between 160 and 191 is change up by the specified number of contrast levels. A value of 255 means that this is and extended event and that the specific contrast level is sent in byte 3 and after.

vscp-type.description: This is typically for adjusting the bass level settings of a sound device. Depending on the implementation, this could automatically adjust the treble level. To adjust left and right bass levels, a node would have to use separate zones or sub-zones for left and right.

element.name: Data1

vscp-class.name: Phone
vscp-class.description: This class is for phone related functionality.

vscp-type.name: General event
vscp-type.description: General Event.

vscp-type.name: Incoming call
vscp-type.description:
There is an incoming phone call. Usually a caller ID node just sends out numerical information. A database event can follow (later) that contains the real text information.
Phone calls are reported in the following form
from,to
where from is the originating number and to is the receiving phone. Numbers is preferable presented in an international form. So a call from England to a Swedish phone should take the following form
44-123-1122334,46-657-413430
which is sent in tree frames. Some device can't separate country and area-code and therefore the form
441231122334,46657413430
will also be valid.
a database connected application can later resolve this and present
A customer,Eurosource
This is the type=8 event, database info, (see below). Note that the comma cant be used in the descriptive names.
Calls from unlisted numbers are presented as
,to

vscp-type.name: Outgoing call
vscp-type.description: There is an outgoing phone call.

vscp-type.name: Ring
vscp-type.description: This is a event indicating that there is a “ring” for this call.

vscp-type.name: Answer
vscp-type.description: The call has been answered.

vscp-type.name: Hangup
vscp-type.description: The call has been terminated by the receiving end.

vscp-type.name: Giveup
vscp-type.description: The call has been terminated by the originating end. byte

vscp-type.name: Transfer
vscp-type.description: The call has been transferred. byte

vscp-type.name: Database Info
vscp-type.description: Call database info.

vscp-class.name: Display
vscp-class.description: This is generic display related functionality. Show info on a screen, LED-display diode, etc.

vscp-type.name: General event
vscp-type.description: General Event.

vscp-type.name: Clear Display
vscp-type.description: Clear the display on displays in a certain zone,sub-zone.

vscp-type.name: Position cursor
vscp-type.description: Move the cursor to a specific position on displays in a certain zone,sub-zone.

vscp-type.name: Write Display
vscp-type.description: Write to display(s) in a certain zone,sub-zone. The update of the display is immediate.

vscp-type.name: Write Display buffer
vscp-type.description: Write to the buffers of displays in a certain zone,sub-zone. The update of the display is is not done right away but is instead done when the Show Buffer event is received by the display unit.

vscp-type.name: Show Display Buffer
vscp-type.description: Tells displays in a certain zone,sub-zone to display the content in their display buffers. The update of the display is immediate.

vscp-type.name: Set Display Buffer Parameter
vscp-type.description: With this call a display buffer parameter can be sent to a display. This parameter is inserted at the escape position %pn in the string in the buffer when the buffer is transferred to the display.\nNote that there are no zone and sub-zone defined for this event and the escapes must instead be chosen to be distinct in a system. This means that &p1 will be unique within a system and updating this parameter will update on all displays that has it defined.

vscp-type.name: Show Text
vscp-type.description: This event contains information that should be displayed on displays pointed out by zone/sub-zone.\nThis event can have the same functionality as Write Display or be set on an higher abstraction level.

vscp-type.name: Set LED
vscp-type.description: This event contains information that should be displayed on LED(s) pointed out by zone/sub-zone.

vscp-type.name: Set RGB Color
vscp-type.description: This event set the color for LED(s) pointed out by zone/sub-zone.

vscp-class.name: IR Remote I/f
vscp-class.description: This is the IR code sent/received from common remote controls.

vscp-type.name: General event
vscp-type.description: General Event.

vscp-type.name: RC5 Send/Receive
vscp-type.description: A RC5 remote code. [http://www.xs4all.nl/~sbp/knowledge/ir/sirc.htm ]Use the VSCP abstract remote format if possible.

vscp-type.name: SONY 12-bit Send/Receive
vscp-type.description: A SONY remote code. [http://www.xs4all.nl/~sbp/knowledge/ir/sirc.htm] Use the VSCP abstract remote format if possible.

vscp-type.name: LIRC (Linux Infrared Remote Control)
vscp-type.description: Packed LIRC codes code. LRC Codes are normally sent as 64-bit codes or even larger codes. Only codes with a length less then 56 bits (7-bytes) are supported by VSCP and the most significant byte of the LIRC code is not transferred. http://www.lirc.org/

vscp-type.name: VSCP Abstract Remote Format
vscp-type.description: Instead of sending codes that relates to a certain remote this format is general. And therefore more flexible

vscp-type.name: MAPito Remote Format
vscp-type.description: Instead of sending codes that relates to a certain remote this format is general. And therefore more flexible.

vscp-class.name: Logging
vscp-class.description: Logging functionality.

vscp-type.name: General event
vscp-type.description: General Event.

vscp-type.name: Log event
vscp-type.description: Message for Log. Several frames have to be sent for a event that take up more the five bytes which is the maximum for each frame. In this case the zero based index (byte 2) should be increased for each frame.

vscp-type.name: Log Start
vscp-type.description: Start logging.

vscp-type.name: Log Stop
vscp-type.description: Stop logging.

vscp-type.name: Log Level
vscp-type.description: Set level for logging.

vscp-class.name: Laboratory use
vscp-class.description: This class is intended for lab usage. No production device should use this event type.

vscp-type.name: General event
vscp-type.description: General Event.

vscp-class.name: Local use
vscp-class.description: This event type is for local defined events. It is thus possible to add user defined events here. In a public environment the risk for collisions with other devices that also use CLASS.LOCAL should be noted. It is good to make user events configurable in the device to give users a chance to avoid problems.

vscp-type.name: General event
vscp-type.description: General Event.
